title: Macron Reappoints Lecornu as PM to Tackle France's Political Crisis
snippets: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister, just days after his resignation, asking him to try again to form a government and produce a budget.
Sébastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".
Four days after he resigned as prime minister, Lecornu is returning to the post.
Just days after his resignation, Sebastien Lecornu is back in the position he had vacated. Lecornu said it was now time to "put an end to this political crisis" as he accepted Macron's nomination.
Premier says he wants to press ahead with efforts to finalise a budget for 2026

Lecornu, who resigned as PM on Monday, is tasked with urgently delivering a budget to parliament The French president, Emmanuel Macron, has reappointed his centrist ally Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister – days after Lecornu dramatically resigned and his new government collapsed after only 14 hour
Sébastien Lecornu resigned as French prime minister this week after less than a month in office, and less than a day after forming a cabinet. Now he’s back.
President Emmanuel Macron is trying to calm the political turmoil that has gripped the country and jeopardized the passage of a budget.
Macron Renames Sebastien Lecornu as France’s New Prime Minister Bloomberg.com
titles: Macron puts Lecornu back as France's prime minister just days after he quit
Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM after days of turmoil
France’s Macron reappoints Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister
France: Macron reappoints Sebastien Lecornu as PM
Macron reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister
France’s Macron reappoints prime minister days after he quit
Macron Reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as France’s Prime Minister
Macron Renames Sebastien Lecornu as France’s New Prime Minister - Bloomberg.com
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as Prime Minister just days after Lecornu resigned from the position. Lecornu, who had left the role after less than a month and a new government collapse within 14 hours, is tasked with forming a government again and producing a budget for 2026. This move aims to address the political crisis and ensure the passage of a crucial budget.

title: S&P 500 Falls 2.7% as Trump Plans More Tariffs on China Amid Tensions
snippets: The S&P 500 closed down 2.7%, its steepest fall since April, after the US president hit out at China.
The US president's announcement comes after China pledged to impose restrictions on the export of rare earth minerals.
The new tariffs on Chinese goods will kick in on November 1. These tariffs are on top of the 30% duties already in place on Chinese imports.
President says measures will include export controls on software and take effect from November 1 ‘or sooner’
Trump Announces Additional 100% Tariff on China, Export Controls Bloomberg.com
Trump threatens 100% tariff on Chinese goods over over rare earth restrictions Axios

President accuses China of ‘very hostile’ moves and says additional tariffs could come on 1 November ‘or sooner’ Donald Trump has threatened to impose additional US tariffs of 100% on China from next month, accusing Beijing of “very hostile” moves to restrict exports of rare earths needed for Americ
The president made the threat after Beijing imposed new global restrictions on the use of rare earth minerals, which are vital supplies for U.S. makers of chips and batteries.
Trump claimed China's export controls on rare earths came "out of nowhere."
The tariffs will go into effect Nov. 1 or sooner, depending on China’s response, according to Trump.
titles: Trump threatens to impose additional 100% tariff on China
Trump to hit China with 100 percent tariff amid escalating trade spat
Trump says he will impose additional 100% tariffs on China
Trump reignites trade war with threat of additional 100% tariff on China
Trump Announces Additional 100% Tariff on China, Export Controls - Bloomberg.com
Trump threatens 100% tariff on Chinese goods over over rare earth restrictions - Axios
Trump threatens 100% China tariffs as Beijing restricts rare-earth exports
Trump Threatens 100% Tariffs on Chinese Goods
“Extremely angry” Trump threatens “massive” tariff on all Chinese exports
Trump Says U.S. Will Impose 100% Tariffs Against China Following Mineral Trade Dispute
summary: The S&P 500 dropped 2.7% after President Trump announced plans to impose an additional 100% tariff on Chinese goods and export controls on software, starting November 1 or sooner. This decision follows China's new restrictions on rare earth mineral exports, essential for U.S. tech manufacturing. These measures add to the existing 30% duties on Chinese imports, escalating tensions between the U.S. and China. Trump criticized China's actions as "very hostile," citing the impact on American industries.

title: 2025 Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Venezuelan Leader María Corina Machado
snippets: Machado is recognised for "tireless work promoting democratic rights" in Venezuela, the Nobel Committee says.
Maria Corina Machado called on Donald Trump directly to help her country which continues to be at crisis.
Former Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who's in hiding, is the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner.
The Nobel Peace Prize for 2025 has gone to Maria Corina Machado. The committee lauded "her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela." Follow DW for more.

Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’ The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”. Machado,
The Nobel Prize Committee honored Machado, who is in hiding, for keeping “the flame of democracy burning.” The White House accused members of “placing politics over peace.”

The Norwegian Nobel Committee praised “her tireless work promoting democratic rights.” Ms. Machado, who built one of Venezuela’s most important political movements, has been in hiding since last year.
Ms. Machado galvanized a movement that independent analysts say won last year’s election, only to have it stolen by President Nicolás Maduro.
Ms. Machado built Venezuela’s biggest opposition movement and lives in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro’s authoritarian government.
Nobel Peace Prize Goes to Venezuela Opposition Leader Machado Bloomberg.com
titles: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize
As Nobel Prize goes to Venezuela's opposition leader, how far would Trump go to help her?
Who is Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Corina Machado?
Maria Corina Machado of Venezuela wins Nobel Peace Prize
Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado wins Nobel peace prize
María Corina Machado, Venezuelan opposition leader, wins Nobel Peace Prize
María Corina Machado of Venezuela Is Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize
María Corina Machado Wins Nobel Peace Prize Despite Trump’s Campaign
Who Is María Corina Machado, the Winner of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize?
Nobel Peace Prize Goes to Venezuela Opposition Leader Machado - Bloomberg.com
summary: The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado for her efforts in promoting democratic rights in Venezuela. The Norwegian Nobel Committee praised her as an exemplar of civilian courage in Latin America, highlighting her work towards a peaceful transition from dictatorship to democracy. Machado, who is currently in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro's government, has been recognized for keeping the flame of democracy alive in Venezuela. This announcement has overshadowed speculation about other potential recipients, including former U.S. Presi

title: AstraZeneca Cuts Drug Costs for Medicaid Under Trump Deal
snippets: The U.K.-based drugmaker became the second to strike a deal with the Trump administration as part of the president's push to rein in U.S. drug prices.
AstraZeneca has agreed to lower prescription drug costs for Medicaid under a deal with the Trump administration

Company to sell some medicines at a discount to US’s Medicaid health plan in exchange for tariff relief Donald Trump announced a deal with the British-based drugmaker AstraZeneca for a “most-favored-nation” drug-pricing model aimed at making prescription medicines more affordable and avoiding the ad
titles: AstraZeneca makes deal with White House to lower drug prices
AstraZeneca agrees to lower drug prices for Medicaid under Trump administration deal
AstraZeneca makes deal with Trump to lower drug prices and avoid tariffs
summary: AstraZeneca, a UK-based drugmaker, has agreed to lower prescription drug costs for Medicaid in the US as part of a deal with the Trump administration. This agreement, aimed at making prescription medicines more affordable, involves selling some medicines at a discount to Medicaid in exchange for tariff relief. This makes AstraZeneca the second company to strike such a deal under Trump's initiative to reduce U.S. drug prices.

title: Cody Bellinger Expected to Opt Out, Enter Free Agency
snippets: Bellinger, a Yankee in 2025, is coming off his best season since 2019
If the Yankees want Cody Bellinger back, it probably won't be cheap.
Yankees Outfielder Cody Bellinger Expected to Opt for Free Agency Sports Illustrated
Outfielder Cody Bellinger is planning to opt out of his contract with the Yankees and become a free agent, ESPN’s Jorge Castillo reported on Friday.
titles: Yankees' Cody Bellinger to opt out of contract and hit free agency, per report
Cody Bellinger to opt out of contract, adding another item to Yankees' offseason checklist
Yankees Outfielder Cody Bellinger Expected to Opt for Free Agency - Sports Illustrated
Report: Yankees’ Cody Bellinger to opt out of contract, become free agent
summary: Cody Bellinger, having had his best season since 2019, is expected to opt out of his contract with the Yankees and enter free agency, according to ESPN's Jorge Castillo. This move suggests that if the Yankees wish to retain Bellinger, it may come at a higher cost.

title: Trump Administration Begins Federal Worker Layoffs Amid Shutdown
snippets: The Trump administration says it has started the process of issuing "substantial" reduction-in-force notices to federal employees. Court filings suggest around 4,200 affected so far.
Trump officials say at least 4,100 federal worker layoffs have begun Axios
The federal government has begun to fire employees. Thousands remain furloughed or are working without pay.
titles: White House says 'substantial' layoffs of federal workers have begun, with few details
Trump officials say at least 4,100 federal worker layoffs have begun - Axios
The White House has identified more than 4,100 federal workers for layoffs as the shutdown drags on
summary: The Trump administration has initiated layoffs of federal workers, following through on a threat linked to the US government shutdown. While the exact number of affected employees and agencies remains unspecified, the move has prompted significant concern, with unions like AFL-CIO planning legal action due to the anticipated negative impact on Americans. This development comes as thousands of federal employees continue to be furloughed or work without pay.

title: Tigers Face Mariners in Game 5 Showdown for ALCS Spot
snippets: Will Detroit secure the win in Seattle to advance to the ALCS or will the Mariners move on to face Toronto?
Mariners will Start George Kirby against Tiger's Tarik Skubal in Deciding Game 5 Sports Illustrated

Tarik Skubal gets the ball for Detroit as the Tigers face George Kirby and the Seattle Mariners in a winner-take-all Game 5 to set up a date with the Blue Jays. First pitch is at 8:08 p.m. ET / 5:08 p.m. PT on Sportsnet and Sportsnet +.
titles: How Mariners, Tigers can win decisive Game 5
Mariners will Start George Kirby against Tiger's Tarik Skubal in Deciding Game 5 - Sports Illustrated
ALDS on Sportsnet: Tigers vs. Mariners, Game 5
summary: In a decisive Game 5 on Friday night, the Detroit Tigers and Seattle Mariners will compete to advance to the ALCS. The Tigers, with Tarik Skubal pitching, aim to upset the Mariners in Seattle and secure a spot to face the Toronto Blue Jays. This marks the second consecutive year the Tigers are on the cusp of reaching the ALCS.

title: Mac Jones to Start for 49ers vs. Buccaneers, Purdy Out with Injury
snippets: Mac Jones is slated to start in place of the injured Brock Purdy on Sunday against the Bucs, while receiver Ricky Pearsall will miss his second straight game.
Jones has yet to lose a start this season but Purdy is still considered San Francisco's franchise QB

Quarterback Brock Purdy will miss his fourth game this season for San Francisco because of a toe injury, and backup Mac Jones is listed as questionable but expected to start on Sunday against Tampa Bay despite being hampered by injuries to his knee and oblique.
titles: 49ers set to start QB Jones again; Pearsall out
49ers QB situation: Brock Purdy (toe) out again, Mac Jones expected to start vs. Buccaneers in Week 6
49ers’ Brock Purdy out again, Mac Jones questionable but expected to start
summary: Mac Jones is expected to start as quarterback for San Francisco against Tampa Bay on Sunday, stepping in for the injured Brock Purdy, who will miss his fourth game of the season due to a toe injury. Despite battling knee and oblique injuries, Jones, who has not lost a start this season, will take the field. Meanwhile, receiver Ricky Pearsall will be sidelined for the second consecutive game. Purdy remains the team's franchise quarterback.

title: Qatar to Build Air Force Training Facility in Idaho, US Announces
snippets: US, Qatar sign letter of agreement to bring Qatari F-15 fighter jet contingent to US base, hail increased cooperation.
Qatar to build air force facility on U.S. base in Idaho Axios
Pentagon’s approval for project draws fire from Maga influencer and Trump ally Laura Loomer
titles: Pentagon chief Hegseth announces Qatari Air Force facility at Idaho base
Qatar to build air force facility on U.S. base in Idaho - Axios
Qatar to build fighter jet facility at US base in Idaho
summary: The US Defense Secretary announced at a Pentagon press conference with Qatar's Defense Minister, Sheikh Saoud bin Abdulrahman Al Thani, that Qatar will construct an air force facility in Idaho. This facility will be used for training Qatari pilots to operate F-15 fighter jets.

title: Explosion at Tennessee Munitions Plant: Unknown Fatalities, 19 Missing
snippets: "There's nothing to describe, it's gone," says Humphreys County Sheriff Mike Davis, who grew emotional while providing an update about the most devastating incident of his career.

Police chief calls explosion near Bucksnort, south-west of Nashville, ‘devastating’ and says ‘we have some deceased’ Nineteen people are missing and feared dead following a huge explosion at a military munitions plant in Tennessee. The powerful blast ripped through the explosives manufacturing plant
The early morning blast leveled a building, prompting a joint investigation and search for missing workers.
titles: Nineteen missing after explosion at Tennessee munitions factory
Nineteen people feared dead after blast at Tennessee munitions plant
Tennessee Munitions Plant Explosion – What We Know
summary: A massive explosion at a military munitions plant in Tennessee resulted in an unknown number of fatalities, with 19 people missing and feared dead. The incident, described as "devastating" by local law enforcement, occurred early in the morning, completely destroying a building. Humphreys County Sheriff Mike Davis and the police chief of Bucksnort confirmed the severity of the situation and a joint investigation is underway to search for missing workers and determine the cause.

title: Explosion at Tennessee Munitions Plant Leaves 19 Missing
snippets: A massive blast at a military explosives factory in the US state of Tennessee has left multiple people dead and missing.
The Humphreys County sheriff confirmed fatalities but gave no tolls, suggesting those missing might already be dead.

McEWEN, Tenn. (AP) — A blast leveled an explosives plant Friday in rural Tennessee, leaving behind a mass of twisted metal, burned-out shells of cars and at least 19 people missing and feared dead, authorities said. “There’s nothing to describe. It’s gone,” Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis said
titles: Blast rips through US military explosives factory in Tennessee
Tennessee: 19 missing after deadly explosives plant blast
Blast at a Tennessee explosives plant leaves 19 people missing and feared dead, sheriff says
summary: A significant explosion at the Accurate Energetic Systems military munitions plant in McEwen, Tennessee, resulted in 19 people missing and feared dead. The incident occurred on Friday, with secondary explosions hindering initial rescue efforts. Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis described the scene as one of the worst he has witnessed.

title: US Government Issues Layoff Notices Amid Shutdown, Affecting Thousands
snippets: Reduction-in-force notifications have gone out to employees in departments including the Treasury and Homeland Security.
HHS layoffs: Trump officials lay off more employees amid government shutdown Axios
HHS would not say how many are being let go, but union says "thousands."
titles: Trump announces layoffs amid government shutdown, despite legal questions
HHS layoffs: Trump officials lay off more employees amid government shutdown - Axios
Trump admin fires more health employees amid government shutdown
summary: The US government has issued reduction-in-force notifications to employees in several departments, including the Treasury and Homeland Security, amid a government shutdown. Additionally, Trump administration officials have laid off more employees within the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), though the exact number has not been disclosed. However, the union representing these workers claims that "thousands" are being affected by these layoffs.

title: Trump Secures Deal with AstraZeneca to Lower Drug Prices, Avoid Tariffs

Trump's pharmaceutical venture strikes a deal with AstraZeneca.

summary: Donald Trump's pharmaceutical venture has successfully negotiated a deal with AstraZeneca to lower drug prices in exchange for a reprieve from tariffs. This agreement was announced by Trump and has been confirmed by sources including Axios and Bloomberg.com.

title: Israel, Hamas Agree on Ceasefire in US-Brokered Peace Deal
snippets: Palestinians begin returning to Gaza's north.
Families eager to return to what's left of their homes are walking back to Gaza City as Israel begins its withdrawal.
Israel began to reposition troops Friday as the clock started on the first phase of an agreement for the release of hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.
Trump’s framework to end the war in Gaza is the basis for an initial agreement between Israel and Hamas.
titles: Israel-Gaza: The Ceasefire Is Now "In Effect"
Families walk back to Gaza City minutes after ceasefire goes into effect
What to know about the Gaza ceasefire deal as it takes effect
What to know about the Gaza ceasefire deal
summary: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the first phase of a peace deal brokered by the US, aiming to end hostilities in Gaza. The deal, approved by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet, includes a ceasefire and the exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners. This agreement marks a significant step towards resolving the two-year conflict, with the ceasefire now in effect.

title: Knicks, Raptors End Legal Dispute Over Confidential Files
snippets: The Knicks and Raptors agreed to voluntarily dismiss a 2023 lawsuit involving the alleged theft of thousands of confidential files, according to a court filing Friday that was obtained by ESPN.
The legal battle spanned more than two years after the Knicks filed the lawsuit
titles: Knicks, Raptors agree to voluntarily dismiss lawsuit
Knicks, Raptors mutually agree to dismiss lawsuit over alleged theft of confidential files, per report
summary: The Knicks and Raptors have mutually agreed to dismiss a lawsuit from 2023, where the Knicks accused the Raptors of stealing thousands of confidential files. This decision, documented in a court filing obtained by ESPN, ends a legal dispute that lasted over two years.

title: S&P 500 Plummets After Trump's New Tariff Threats on China
snippets: Biggest one-day drop in S&P 500 since April brings weeks long rally to a halt
VIX Soars But Equity Market Remains Orderly After Trump Threatens China Tariffs Bloomberg.com
Copper Tumbles as Trump Threatens Massive New Tariffs on China Bloomberg.com
Treasuries Climb After Trump Threatens Higher Tariffs on China Bloomberg.com
titles: US stocks close sharply lower after Trump threatens new China tariffs
VIX Soars But Equity Market Remains Orderly After Trump Threatens China Tariffs - Bloomberg.com
Copper Tumbles as Trump Threatens Massive New Tariffs on China - Bloomberg.com
Treasuries Climb After Trump Threatens Higher Tariffs on China - Bloomberg.com
summary: The S&P 500 experienced its largest one-day decline since April, ending a weeks-long rally, following President Trump's threat of new tariffs on China. This announcement also led to a significant increase in the VIX, indicating higher market volatility, though the equity market remained orderly. Additionally, the price of copper fell sharply, and U.S. Treasuries saw a rise as investors sought safer assets amid the heightened trade tensions between the U.S. and China.

title: Rahm Eyes Fourth Spanish Open Title; Lowry Misses Cut
snippets: Jon Rahm made seven birdies to get back into contention for a fourth title at the Spanish Open on Friday.
Jon Rahm raced back into contention for the weekend, but Ryder Cup-winning team-mate Shane Lowry missed the cut, on the second day of the Open de Espana presented by Madrid.
titles: Jon Rahm surges into contention for fourth Spanish Open title; Shane Lowry misses cut
Rahm surges back but Ryder Cup hero Lowry misses cut in Madrid
summary: Jon Rahm made a strong comeback at the Spanish Open with seven birdies, positioning himself for a potential fourth title. Meanwhile, Shane Lowry, his Ryder Cup teammate, missed the cut. Rahm's performance puts him in contention for the weekend rounds.

title: Ontario Offers $50K Reward in Robbie Thomson Disappearance Case
snippets: Robbie Thomson was reported missing on Oct. 19, 2023.

The Government of Ontario is now offering a $50,000 reward for information leading to a conviction in the case of a missing Smith Falls man. Robbie Thomson, now 36, was reported missing on Oct. 19, 2023 but is believed to have gone missing sometime between Oct. 12 and Oct. 18. The OPP and Smith Fall
titles: $50,000 reward offered in disappearance of Smiths Falls man
Ontario offering $50K reward two years after disappearance of Smith Falls man
summary: The Government of Ontario is offering a $50,000 reward for information leading to a conviction in the disappearance of Robbie Thomson, 36, from Smith Falls. Reported missing on Oct. 19, 2023, it's believed he went missing between Oct. 12 and Oct. 18. The Ontario Provincial Police are investigating.

title: Deadly Earthquakes Strike Near Southern Philippines, 7 Killed
snippets: Quakes of 7.4 and 6.8 magnitude trigger tsunami alerts as people living near coast advised to evacuate Two powerful offshore earthquakes struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Friday, killing at least seven people, while towns near the epicentre faced structural damage and authorities w
The quake struck off the eastern coast of Mindanao island on Friday morning and was followed by a 6.7-magnitude aftershock. A tsunami warning was issued.
titles: Seven people killed after twin earthquakes off coast of Philippines
At Least Seven Dead After 7.4-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Southern Philippines
summary: Two offshore earthquakes, magnitudes 7.4 and 6.8, hit near the southern Philippines, causing at least seven deaths and structural damage in coastal towns. The quakes occurred off Mindanao island's eastern coast, prompting a tsunami warning and evacuation advisories.

title: Boring Co. Violates Environmental Laws 800 Times, Including Unauthorized Digging
snippets: The Boring Co. violated state environmental regulations nearly 800 times, many of which occurred after signing an agreement saying it would comply.
Violations include digging without permits and dumping wastewater into storm drains.
titles: Musk’s Boring Co. violated environmental regulations nearly 800 times, Nevada alleges
Boring Company cited for almost 800 environmental violations in Las Vegas
summary: The Boring Co. breached state environmental laws almost 800 times, including unauthorized digging and disposing of wastewater in storm drains. These infractions persisted even after the company agreed to follow regulations.

title: Afghan Man Found Guilty of Threatening Nigel Farage on TikTok
snippets: Fayaz Khan, 26, is described by the prosecution as "a dangerous man with an interest in firearms".

Fayaz Khan, 26, made the threat in a TikTok video that Reform UK leader told the court was ‘pretty chilling’ A man who came to the UK on a small boat has been found guilty of making a threat to kill Nigel Farage in a TikTok video. Fayaz Khan, 26, an Afghan national, was found guilty by a majority of
titles: Man guilty of threatening to kill Nigel Farage
Man who entered UK on small boat found guilty of threatening to kill Nigel Farage
summary: Fayaz Khan, 26, an Afghan national who arrived in the UK on a small boat, was found guilty of making a threat to kill Nigel Farage in a TikTok video, described by the prosecution as chilling. Khan, characterized as dangerous and interested in firearms, was convicted by a majority verdict.

title: IUCN: Over Half of Bird Species Declining, Arctic Seals at Risk, Green Turtles R
snippets: Biodiversity losses are growing, the IUCN reports as summit opens, but green turtle’s recovery ‘reminds us conservation works’ More than half of all bird species are in decline, according to a new global assessment, with deforestation driving sharp falls in populations across the planet. On the eve

Arctic seals are being pushed closer to extinction by climate change and more than half of bird species around the world are declining under pressure from deforestation and agricultural expansion, according to an annual assessment from the International Union for Conservation of Nature.
titles: More than half of world’s bird species in decline, as leaders meet on extinction crisis
Arctic seals and more than half of bird species are in trouble on latest list of threatened species
summary: The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) reports significant biodiversity losses, with over half of bird species worldwide in decline due to deforestation and agricultural expansion. The annual assessment also highlights the threat of climate change on Arctic seals, pushing them closer to extinction. However, the recovery of green turtles serves as a positive reminder that conservation efforts can be effective.

title: Peru Impeaches President Boluarte, José Jerí Sworn in as Interim Leader
snippets: Congress leader José Jerí sworn in as interim president as majority of lawmakers initiate impeachment against Boluarte Lawmakers in Peru have voted to remove the president, Dina Boluarte, whose term has been marked by protests and accusations of failing to stem crime. Boluarte refused to appear befo
Growing outrage over crime and political scandals eroded support for President Dina Boluarte, the country’s most unpopular leader in recent history.
titles: Peru lawmakers vote to oust president Dina Boluarte over crime crisis
Peru Ousts President Amid Crime Surge
summary: Peruvian lawmakers voted to impeach President Dina Boluarte, marking a significant political change in a country facing violence and instability. This decision, supported by almost all legislative factions, follows Boluarte's criticized handling of rising crime rates. José Jerí, a Congress leader, was sworn in as interim president until the April 2026 elections, succeeding Boluarte who faced protests and accusations during her term.

title: Stevia Compound Boosts Hair Growth Treatment Efficacy in Mice Study
snippets: Researchers discovered that stevioside, a compound from the Stevia plant, enhances the skin absorption of minoxidil, the main treatment for pattern baldness. In mice, a stevioside-infused patch boosted hair follicle activity and new hair growth. The approach could pave the way for more natural, effe
Applying a daily serum that contains extracts of a tropical plant improved hair density and strand thickness in just 56 days
titles: A sweet fix for baldness? Stevia compound boosts hair growth
Serum based on plant extracts boosts hair growth in weeks
summary: Researchers found that stevioside from the Stevia plant increases skin absorption of minoxidil, a common baldness treatment, promoting hair growth in mice. Additionally, a serum with tropical plant extracts improved hair density and thickness in 56 days, suggesting potential for natural, effective hair loss treatments.

title: Photographers Chronicle Cumbia Music's Reach in the Americas
snippets: Photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia music in Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina and the United States.
Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Perú, Argentina y Estados Unidos.
titles: Peru: Chicha, the electric pulse of cumbia
Perú: Chicha, el pulso eléctrico de la cumbia
summary: Photographers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky have documented the cumbia music genre across Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina, and the United States, showcasing its popularity in the Americas.
